content.user_title: Build crypto trading bots with Hummingbot
content.value_statement: Creating automated crypto trading strategies requires understanding complex exchange APIs and trading algorithms. This skill provides comprehensive documentation and guidance for using Hummingbot to build, configure, and run algorithmic trading strategies across multiple cryptocurrency exchanges.
actual_capabilities: Guide through exchange connector setup and configuration
Describe trading strategy templates and controllers
Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues
Explain Gateway DEX integration and blockchain connectivity
Detail Hummingbot API and MCP server usage
limitations: Does not execute trades or manage API keys
Does not provide real-time market data
Does not connect to exchanges directly
Requires separate Hummingbot installation to run bots

best_practices: Use paper trade mode to test strategies before using real funds
Set up kill switch to automatically stop bots at defined loss thresholds
Configure rate limit sharing when running multiple bot instances
Use balance limits to prevent over-exposure on single exchanges
anti_patterns: Running live bots without first testing in paper trade mode
Using API keys with withdrawal permissions on exchanges
Ignoring kill switch settings when trading with leverage
Running multiple strategies on the same trading pair without coordination

faq.question: Which exchanges does Hummingbot support?
faq.answer: Hummingbot supports 50+ exchange connectors including Binance, Coinbase, Kraken, Kucoin, Hyperliquid for CEX trading, and Uniswap, Jupiter, PancakeSwap for DEX trading.

faq.question: What are the system requirements?
faq.answer: Docker Desktop for Windows/Mac or Linux with Docker Compose. 4GB RAM minimum, 8GB recommended. Supports x86 and ARM architectures.

faq.question: Can I use Hummingbot with AI assistants?
faq.answer: Yes, Hummingbot MCP Server enables integration with Claude, Gemini, and Codex CLI for natural language trading bot management and portfolio queries.

faq.question: Is my API key data safe?
faq.answer: API keys are encrypted locally with your password. Hummingbot is client-side software - no data is sent to external servers except exchange APIs.

faq.question: Why is my bot not connecting to Gateway?
faq.answer: Check Gateway is running: docker ps | grep gateway. Verify GATEWAY_PASSPHRASE matches. Ensure ports 15888 are not blocked by firewall.

faq.question: How does Hummingbot compare to other trading bots?
faq.answer: Hummingbot is open source, highly modular, and community-maintained. It supports more exchange connectors than most alternatives and offers advanced V2 strategy framework.
